author: Timothy Linward
description:
If one good thing has come from the era of ‘early access’ videogames, it’s that gamers have a framework to understand that sometimes, a game gets better over time. Several games have managed to move from early access to full release in the last couple of years - 10th edition 40k getting those all important early errata, Fallout Factions sneakily gaining rules for a huge range of miniatures - and most recently Warcrow, which has come into its own with its latest starter set, Song of the Dormant.

Continue reading New starter set Song of the Dormant is fantasy wargame Warcrow's real v1 launch
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best miniature wargames, Best board games, How to
title: New starter set Song of the Dormant is fantasy wargame Warcrow's real v1 launch

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Have you ever dreamt of staying in a luxurious, UNO-themed hotel room? You liar. That’s the experience offered to one competition winner, though, at what Mattel is calling “the first-ever UNO Social Club”.

Continue reading Mattel cheapens family card game brand Uno with bizarre casino crossover
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best playing card games, Kids’ board games, Best family board games
title: Mattel cheapens family card game brand Uno with bizarre casino crossover

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Pokémon Pocket has revealed more details about its new plans for trading, which we now know will come into effect on July 27. This reworking of the system was previously promised for the end of Autumn, so it would appear that the developers are ahead of schedule.

Continue reading Pokémon Pocket's trade overhaul arrives this month, with 60 free hourglasses
MORE FROM WARGAMER: How many Pokémon are there?, How to play Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards
title: Pokémon Pocket's trade overhaul arrives this month, with 60 free hourglasses

author: Mollie Russell
description:
A new trailer for Dungeons and Dragons’ upcoming starter set, Heroes of the Borderlands, has confirmed its price. A physical copy can be pre-ordered from Amazon and D&DBeyond for $49.99. Wizards of the Coast’s previous starter set sold for $19.99 – less than half the price of Heroes of the Borderlands.

Continue reading DnD reveals new starter set costs twice as much as the old one
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: DnD reveals new starter set costs twice as much as the old one

author: Timothy Linward
description:
A very small piece of lore has been omitted from the third edition Warhammer: the Horus Heresy rulebook. In the ‘Process of Initiation’ sidebar which describes how Space Marines are created, no reference is made to the gender of Space Marine initiates, removing the second edition’s explicit statement that the process relies on the “hormonal and biological make-up of the human male”.

Continue reading New Warhammer rulebook ditches controversial gender language for Space Marines
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Horus Heresy book order, Warhammer 40k factions, Warhammer 40k primarchs
title: New Warhammer rulebook ditches controversial gender language for Space Marines

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The MTG card Agatha’s Soul Cauldron was always expensive, but over the past couple of weeks it’s risen to new heights. This artifact from Wilds of Eldraine has become a key player in Standard, ever since the massive wave of bannings at the end of June which completely transformed the format.

Continue reading Standard has a new $70 MTG card, after bans rewrite the meta
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: Standard has a new $70 MTG card, after bans rewrite the meta
